source:
# Check for new, updated or deleted data
- This script checks for new, updated or deleted data by checking the source data (horizon tables) against the target (odw_harmonised_db.casework tables)
- **New Data:** where an main Reference in the source does not exist in the target, then NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Updated data:** Comparison occurs on Reference Fields in source and in target where the row hash is different i.e. there is a change in one of the columns. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Deleted data:** where an Reference info in the target exists but the same identifyers don't exist in the source. DeletedData flag is set to 'Y'

## View entraid_new is created

%%sql
-- Build entraid_new table
-- Gets modified or deleted from source rows

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW entraid_new 

     AS

-- gets data that matches of SourceID and flags that it is modified based on a row (md5) hash. Flags as "NewData"
-- gets data that is in the target but not in source. Flags as "DeletedData"

SELECT DISTINCT
    CASE
        WHEN T1.id IS NULL
        THEN T2.EmployeeEntraId
        ELSE NULL
    END                             AS EmployeeEntraId,
    T1.id                           AS id,
    T1.employeeId                   AS employeeId,
    T1.givenName                    AS givenName,
    T1.surname                      AS surname,
    T1.userPrincipalName            AS userPrincipalName,
    "0"                             AS Migrated,
    "EntraID"                       AS ODTSourceSystem,
    T3.SourceSystemID               AS SourceSystemID,
    to_timestamp(T1.expected_from)  AS IngestionDate,
    NULL                            AS ValidTo,
    md5(
        concat(
            IFNULL(T1.id,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.employeeId,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.givenName,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.surname,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.userPrincipalName,'.')
        ))                          AS RowID, -- this hash should contain all the defining fields
    'Y'                             AS IsActive,
    T2.IsActive                     AS HistoricIsActive

FROM odw_standardised_db.entraid T1
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.main_sourcesystem_fact T3 ON "SAP HR" = T3.Description AND T3.IsActive = 'Y'
FULL JOIN odw_harmonised_db.entraid T2 ON T1.id = T2.id AND T2.IsActive = 'Y'
WHERE
    -- flags new data        
    (CASE
        WHEN T1.id = T2.id AND md5(
            concat(
                IFNULL(T1.id,'.'),
                IFNULL(T1.employeeId,'.'),
                IFNULL(T1.givenName,'.'),
                IFNULL(T1.surname,'.'),
                IFNULL(T1.userPrincipalName,'.')
            )) <> T2.RowID  -- same row, changed data
        THEN 'Y'
        WHEN T2.id IS NULL -- new employeeId
        THEN 'Y'
    ELSE 'N'
    END  = 'Y')
    AND T1.id IS NOT NULL
    AND T1.expected_from = (SELECT MAX(expected_from) FROM odw_standardised_db.entraid)

# Dataset is created that contains changed data and corresponding target data
- This script combines data that has been updated, Deleted or is new, with corresponding target data
- View **entraid_new** is unioned to the target data filter to only those rows where changes have been detected
## View entraid_changed_rows is created

%%sql
-- Create new and updated dataset

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW entraid_changed_rows

    AS

-- gets updated, deleted and new rows 
Select 
    EmployeeEntraId,
    id,
    employeeId,
    givenName,
    surname,
    userPrincipalName,
    Migrated,
    ODTSourceSystem,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive

From entraid_new WHERE HistoricIsActive = 'Y' or HistoricIsActive IS NULL

    UNION ALL

-- gets original versions of updated rows so we can update EndDate and set IsActive flag to 'N'
SELECT
    EmployeeEntraId,
    id,
    employeeId,
    givenName,
    surname,
    userPrincipalName,
    Migrated,
    ODTSourceSystem,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
    
FROM odw_harmonised_db.entraid
WHERE id IN (SELECT id FROM entraid_new WHERE id IS NULL) AND IsActive = 'Y';

%%sql

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW Loading_month

    AS

SELECT DISTINCT
    IngestionDate AS IngestionDate,
    to_timestamp(date_sub(IngestionDate,1)) AS ClosingDate,
    'Y' AS IsActive

FROM entraid_new;

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW entraid_changed_rows_final

    AS

SELECT 
    EmployeeEntraId,
    id,
    employeeId,
    givenName,
    surname,
    userPrincipalName,
    Migrated,
    ODTSourceSystem,
    T1.SourceSystemID,
    T1.IngestionDate,
    T1.ValidTo,
    T1.RowID,
    T1.IsActive,
    T2.ClosingDate
FROM entraid_changed_rows T1
FULL JOIN Loading_month T2 ON T1.IsActive = T2.IsActive

# View entraid_changed_rows is used in a merge (Upsert) statement into the target table
- **WHEN MATCHED** ON the surrogate Key (i.e. EmployeeEntraId), EndDate is set to today -1 day and the IsActive flag is set to 'N'
- **WHEN NOT MATCHED** ON the surrogate Key, insert rows
## Table odw_harmonised_db.entraid is updated

%%sql

-- merge into dim table
MERGE INTO odw_harmonised_db.entraid AS Target
USING entraid_changed_rows_final AS Source

ON Source.id = Target.id AND Target.IsActive = 'Y'

-- For Updates existing rows

WHEN MATCHED
    THEN 
    UPDATE SET
    Target.ValidTo = to_timestamp(ClosingDate),
    Target.IsActive = 'N'

-- Insert completely new rows

WHEN NOT MATCHED 
    THEN INSERT (
        EmployeeEntraId,
        id,
        employeeId,
        givenName,
        surname,
        userPrincipalName,
        Migrated,
        ODTSourceSystem,
        SourceSystemID,
        IngestionDate,
        ValidTo,
        RowID,
        IsActive)
    VALUES (
        Source.EmployeeEntraId,
        Source.id,
        Source.employeeId,
        Source.givenName,
        Source.surname,
        Source.userPrincipalName,
        Source.Migrated,
        Source.ODTSourceSystem,
        Source.SourceSystemID,
        Source.IngestionDate,
        Source.ValidTo,
        Source.RowID,
        Source.IsActive)

# Fix the IDs
- No auto-increment feature is available in delta tables, therefore we need to create new IDs for the inserted rows
- This is done by select the target data and using INSERT OVERWRITE to re-insert the data is a new Row Number
## Table odw_harmonised_db.entraid is updated

%%sql
-- Insert new entraid

INSERT OVERWRITE odw_harmonised_db.entraid

SELECT 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY EmployeeEntraId NULLS LAST) AS EmployeeEntraId,
    id,
    employeeId,
    givenName,
    surname,
    userPrincipalName,
    Migrated,
    ODTSourceSystem,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
    
FROM odw_harmonised_db.entraid;
